Why do I need to pay attention to the "not-a-virus" or "PUP" warnings from Avast and Kaspersky when installing Verus?

The "not-a-virus" or "PUP" warnings from Avast and Kaspersky are not necessarily a problem. These warnings are triggered because Verus is mining software, which may be installed by a third party to exploit your PC. However, in this case, you are intentionally installing Verus, so these warnings are false positives. You can review the resources provided to learn more about these false positives.

**MacOS:** https://www.virustotal.com/gui/file/4d87f5f96a475d138a5e111ca7f13ddec4da546ccceb7308b742db08ecf8fb5e/detection
**Linux-x86-64:** https://www.virustotal.com/gui/file/6269809d114d14fe133bab31f945c29407f755627bb1787655ff8973ba67b096/detection
**Linux-ARM64:** https://www.virustotal.com/gui/file/eed44b0a8110269eb5b0d3db09a999be3e1f17bd91abe11c18a7ad20c1b47708/detection
**Windows:** https://www.virustotal.com/gui/file/8e6e96a978c3690183654b497cf7d080d72e6ecb9e0070d2283e7b69c937777a/detectionAvast and Kaspersky may flag the software as "not-a-virus" or "PUP". These are warnings that you are installing mining software, which may be installed by a third party to exploit your PC.
To find out more about the false positives, review the following resources:
https://blog.malwarebytes.com/detections/pup-optional-bitcoinminer/
https://www.kaspersky.com/blog/not-a-virus/18015/### Verifying Downloads
A txt file containing the signer, standard sha256 file checksum, and signature, is included for each download. These packages have been signed with the identity "Verus Coin Foundation Releases@".
1) Extract downloaded archive
2) Verify signature for the extracted archive using the extracted text file.
3) Extract archive to desired directory
### CLI examples
**Verifying file directly**
```
./verus verifyfile "Verus Coin Foundation Releases@" "Ad+PJgABQR9Zgmo5lAenuOeur65N/uzpvHTnirNh7zZ5bp2jGAfDVWT0FlZEo3TjklPzhSG8rYq1yQLQ/lCIsQaWcIF19TBB" "/Downloads/Verus-CLI-Linux-v1.0.1-x86_64/Verus-CLI-Linux-v1.0.1-x86_64.tar.gz"
```
**Verifying using a checksum**
```
./verus verifyhash "Verus Coin Foundation Releases@" "Ad+PJgABQR9Zgmo5lAenuOeur65N/uzpvHTnirNh7zZ5bp2jGAfDVWT0FlZEo3TjklPzhSG8rYq1yQLQ/lCIsQaWcIF19TBB" 7ebad8a3636a06159fd33a91c25c98538f01afcf44824a9c85fccfadd61b0c4a
```
How do I verify the downloads without using the provided txt file with the signer, standard sha256 file checksum, and signature?

You can't. Verus provides a txt file with the signer, standard sha256 file checksum, and signature for each download. This file is necessary to verify the download. You need to extract the downloaded archive, verify the signature for the extracted archive using the extracted text file, and then extract the archive to the desired directory. CLI examples are also provided to help with the verification process.

**MacOS:** https://www.virustotal.com/gui/file/4d87f5f96a475d138a5e111ca7f13ddec4da546ccceb7308b742db08ecf8fb5e/detection
**Linux-x86-64:** https://www.virustotal.com/gui/file/6269809d114d14fe133bab31f945c29407f755627bb1787655ff8973ba67b096/detection
**Linux-ARM64:** https://www.virustotal.com/gui/file/eed44b0a8110269eb5b0d3db09a999be3e1f17bd91abe11c18a7ad20c1b47708/detection
**Windows:** https://www.virustotal.com/gui/file/8e6e96a978c3690183654b497cf7d080d72e6ecb9e0070d2283e7b69c937777a/detectionAvast and Kaspersky may flag the software as "not-a-virus" or "PUP". These are warnings that you are installing mining software, which may be installed by a third party to exploit your PC.
To find out more about the false positives, review the following resources:
https://blog.malwarebytes.com/detections/pup-optional-bitcoinminer/

Can I use any identity to sign the Verus downloads?
No, the Verus downloads are signed with the specific identity "Verus Coin Foundation Releases@". You need to use this exact identity to verify the downloads.

**MacOS:** https://www.virustotal.com/gui/file/4d87f5f96a475d138a5e111ca7f13ddec4da546ccceb7308b742db08ecf8fb5e/detection
**Linux-x86-64:** https://www.virustotal.com/gui/file/6269809d114d14fe133bab31f945c29407f755627bb1787655ff8973ba67b096/detection
**Linux-ARM64:** https://www.virustotal.com/gui/file/eed44b0a8110269eb5b0d3db09a999be3e1f17bd91abe11c18a7ad20c1b47708/detection
**Windows:** https://www.virustotal.com/gui/file/8e6e96a978c3690183654b497cf7d080d72e6ecb9e0070d2283e7b69c937777a/detectionAvast and Kaspersky may flag the software as "not-a-virus" or "PUP".
